answers.answer: Thanks for using the forum. I am happy to address your questions, and my answer will be based on the information you provided here. Please make sure you recognize that this forum is for educational purposes only, and it does not substitute for a formal office visit with a doctor.Without the ability to examine and obtain a history, I can not tell you what the exact cause of the symptoms is. However I will try to provide you with some useful information.I would recommend you follow up at an academic medical center. Many of your symptoms may ultimately be related to your hepatitis C treatment and the consequences of the treatment – which could have eventually caused some of your other symptoms (but not all).Thank you for this opportunity to answer your questions, I hope you find the information I have provided useful, good luck.

question: Back in 94 I was diagnosed with chronic Heptatis C.  They said I had had it for more that twenty years I was about 39 at the time.  I had two turns of alpha A interferon and that took care of it pretty much.   Yet their were some passengers--Sjogens Syn.,Hashimotos Syn., Cryoglobulinemia. Perhaps more that I don't remember.  This year I was diagnosed with Sleep Apnea.  I had double jaw surgery.  The surgeon said I have Ischemia.  Now between 1997 I was put on Betasaron for MS.  I have Myelin on the Hypocampus of my Brain and it interfers with me making short term memories.  Last year, I saw a hand surgeon,  he said I had  carpal tunnel. on my left hand.  I  visited a foot doctor and he said I had nerve irritations in my toes.  My endocrinologist said that I have metabolic disorder (pre diabetes)  I think is the Cryoglobulinemia.  What kind of doctor, where would I find one who would be looking for the single problem rather than dissecting me.  I live in S. New Jersey and usually go to Thomas Jefferson University Hospital.  But they do not seem to have anyone interested.
title: what doctors and where
